title: Petition/Discussion for in-game voice chat.
body:
**This would promote more effective communication among teams:**

You wouldn't have to take your hands off your useful buttons to type, and no more accidental Summoner spell pops because you didn't hit Enter properly.
Less salt and toxicity, in my opinion it is much easier to type abuse than it is to verbally say it to another human.
Premades no longer have the advantage over the enemy team of having voice comms.
People can verbally MIA!!!!!!!!!
It's 2015. VOIP has been out for a while now Riot...
**On a sidenote:**
In my opinion, it's pretty rich to offer a VOIP service to your LCS players while they're hitting the bigtime, but not have one embedded in the game that the rest of your community plays.

**TL,DR: Bump if you want VOIP in-game. Also post your pros and cons in the comments.**

replies.body: Yeah i totally want to hear all the squeaky 12vie voices.
If they're on my team I want to communicate quickly and effectively, squeeker or no squeeker.

Then go install curse and use that.

Voice comms should always be opt in.
I do use curse, but most often no one else on my team does. Comms could still be optional, just like all chat is.
Yeah meaning no one else is opting into voice comms.

It's actually easier to verbally abuse you someone than write out a string of text to abuse them.

When you're in the street and someone does something frustrating you don't stop to write a letter you just open your mouth.

I can show restraint by not writing abusive messages but sometimes when angry I'll just say things

I mean it's easier to send a message, due to a lack of empathy, rather than to confront them verbally. Conversing with someone allows you to recognize them as a human, not just a feeding piece of trash that should be gunned down. I get mad and do my share of snide remarks too, but i'd much prefer to be able to talk to someone who made a mistake or apologize for my mistake verbally and not have to stop playing the game to type out something whiney like "gg vayne can't last hit" or "this jungler just smited my siege minion and left lane wtf".

Your rationale is good but the fact is. League of Legends as it stands is a very toxic environment. Players are already finding it hard enough to deal with the written abuse thrown at them. Do we really want to give players another platform to abuse players with? External voice systems such as Curse and Skype allow for users to control who they talk to. Chances are no one will be verbally abusing each other in Curse or Skype...unless your friends a total d1ck. But hey. That's just my opinion.

The mute button would still exist. There will be toxic players in every community, League especially as it's so addictive and competitive. {{item:3751}}ing will continue to occur with or without voice chat, and I believe we should be promoting communication and teamwork, not preventing solid features from improving our experience just because of the idiots that just want to argue.
